entry.title: Re: How to merge a Business Partner to Both Customer and...
entry.content: Yes, you have to define a vendor account group that mirrors the customer account group KOST, and then link it properly in Customizing > SPRO → Financial Accounting → Accounts Payable → Supplier Accounts → Master Data → Define Account Groups with Screen Layout (Vendors). Here create a vendor account group with the same number range logic as the customer account group. Ensure both customer and vendor account groups use external number assignment if you want the BP number to match. Link BP Grouping to Vendor Account Group and tick 'Same Number', if you want the BP number to be reused for the vendor. Once the mapping is complete, go to transaction BP, select the existing BP, and add the FLVN00 role. The system should now allow the vendor role to be added without error.

entry.title: Streamlined Provisioning and Integration of SuccessFactors Learning (Post 1H 2022 Update)
entry.content:
Overview

With the 1H 2022 release, SAP SuccessFactors introduced major changes to how the Learning module is provisioned and integrated. These updates support deeper integration with the HXM Core Suite, Talent Intelligence Hub, and Story Reporting. As part of this shift, native Learning admin login was deprecated, and a new provisioning method through me.sap.com was introduced.

This guide provides a step-by-step explanation of the updated provisioning and integration process to help consultants navigate it smoothly.

Step 1 – Provision Learning via me.sap.com

Prerequisites

- A client S-user ID with access to provisioning
- SuccessFactors Provisioning backend login

Instance Types

Based on your license, the following instances are typically available:
- Test
- Development
- Production

Note: A Customer Demo system with best practice data may also be available but is not covered here.

Provisioning Steps

  1. Log in to https://me.sap.com using your client’s S-user ID.
    2. Navigate to: Systems & Provisioning or use the direct link: https://me.sap.com/systemsprovisioning
    3. Under the Provisioning tab:
       - Identify the learning system to be provisioned
       - Click Start Provisioning for Test and Production
       - After requesting, the systems will move to a new section called Provisioning Status
       - Wait for the status to show Provided (this may take up to one day)

    Me.sap.com Provisioning

     

    Provisioned systems

     



    Important Note:
    The Development instance can only be provisioned after the Production instance is provisioned. (This is SAP’s practice, though no official explanation is provided.)

    Development provisioning optionAll Provided Learning Tenants

Step 2 – Configuration in SuccessFactors Provisioning

URL Format: <your_company_url>/provisioning_login

Company Settings Configuration

  1. Navigate to: Provisioning > Company Settings
       - Enable: Enable SuccessFactors Learning Integration
       - (Optional) Enable: Enable granting SuccessFactors Learning roles to permission groups
    2. Copy the auto-generated Learning URL shown in the interface.

    Enable Learning

    Then, format and save the following values:
    - Learning Base URL: https://yourCompanyId.lms.hr.cloud.sap
    - /Assertion Consumer Service/SSO Login URL: https://yourCompanyId.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/saml/SSO
    - Logout URL: https://yourCompanyId.lms.hr.cloud.sap/learning/saml/SingleLogout

    3. Go to: Provisioning > Authorized SP Assertion Consumer Service Settings
       - Add the three URLs above

    ACH urls

Step 3 – Admin User Setup

In Successfactors Provisioning

Navigate to: Provisioning > Company Profile
ctrl+f and Search for “admin username” and create a new admin user named PLATEAU (or SFADMIN)
please use uppercase letters while creating admins

Admin Creation

 

In the Instance (BizX)

  1. Set up a Role-Based Permission (RBP) role for Learning Admin access
    2. Create a Permission Group and include the PLATEAU user
    3. Proxy in as the PLATEAU user
    4. Navigate to Learning Administration (first-time load may take several minutes)
    5. In Learning Administration:
       - Go to: People > Users > Add New
       - Create a new Learning Admin user using your credentials

Next steps -  Syncing BizX Users with Learning

To bring user data from the core SuccessFactors system into Learning, follow the configuration steps documented in official SAP blogs and implementation design principles.

Refer to the following resources for in-depth guidance:
 SuccessFactors: Goodbye Provisioning Jobs Part 1 | Using Integration Center (IC) for synchronizing user data from Foundation to LMS via SF - User Connector 
 Impact of Implementing Employee Central for LMS Customers 

References

 3209088 - Integrating HCM/BizX and LMS/Learning Post 1H 2022 Release

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to enable the time recording for customer contracts?
entry.content: Customer Contracts: There is no scope question available in the Business Configuration for enabling time recording directly from customer contracts 1. Workaround: If you need time recording functionality linked to a contract, consider creating a Service Order from the contract. Time recorded against the Service Order will then appear in the employee’s time sheet.

entry.title: Re: Newly created materials not included in MICN for cycl...
entry.content:
SAP calculates the planned count date for cycle counting based on the last physical inventory date (DLINL in MARD) or, if no count has occurred, the material creation date (ERSDA in MSTA). Then it adds the interval defined for the cycle count indicator (A/B/C/D) in customizing (Table T159C-ININV). So if your materials were created on June 1, and the interval for indicator D is 120 days, the system won’t suggest them for counting until October 1 or later. That’s why MICN only picks them when you push the planned count date beyond 4 months.

What you can do is verify Interval Settings, adjust if needed to align with your October 15 target. Use October 1 as the Base Date, when scheduling MICN, set the base date to October 1. This will reset the interval calculation for the new fiscal year. Run MICN with “Set Posting Block” and this ensures materials are locked for counting and not missed due to movement.

Check this SAP Help documentation for more details.

entry.title: Welcome our Next Release 3.0 FP03 of PLM System Integration for SAP S/4HANA
entry.content:
Dear PLM community,

Change is a constant in life, yet one thing you can rely on is that we are constantly working on enhancing our add-on to ensure that you can enjoy regular improvements of our functions and usability. So I am happy to announce yet another feature pack of PLM System Integration for SAP S/4HANA. Curious to learn more? Here you go!

Enhanced Classification of Change Object, Document Version, and Vendor

You can now exchange classification information with an external PLM system using a new field Class Type: You can assign a received class to a change object, document version, or product version. For vendor data, you can now map class assignments and characteristics for inbound and outbound requests.

Local Substitutes for Bills of Material Under Version Control

PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA now allows you to create alternative groups in PEO bills of material under version control, based on information from a structure version substitute. Use the new Domain Model source structure Structure Version Substitutes Extension Fields <SUBSTITUTES-EXTENSION_FIELDS> and the new target structure Alternative version BOM item data </PLMS/S_ALT_MPES_VERSBOMITM_IN> to map attributes of substitutes. This structure allows you to set different values for the same SAP attributes for components and substitutes simultaneously.

Phantom Support for the Allocation of Production Operation List (POL) Components

The transfer of production operation lists has been enhanced: You can now transfer POLs that include component allocations of subassemblies which are marked as phantom to production routing. Assign phantom components to routing operations and transfer them for classic routing as well as PEO routing scenarios. This enhancement supports a more detailed and accurate management of bill of material (BOM) items. Ensure a precise allocation using successor keys to assign the actual leaf components of phantom items.

If materials are defined as Phantom using the special procurement type (SOBSL) in the material master, BOM components that contain this material are flagged as Phantom. Phantoms or components of phantom explosions can then be assigned during routing component assignment.

Additionally, this functionality supports suboperations: You can allocate leaf components of phantom items both at operation and suboperation level. Thus, you can effectively manage complex BOM structures, enjoying improved flexibility and accuracy during BOM component assignment.

Improved Product Structure Component Grouping

PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA now can handle the grouping of product structure components based on the group ID as an additional criterion for version-controlled bills of material.

The integration lets your SAP S/4HANA system consume an external grouping identifier to help control the grouping of BOM items for version BOMs. Two new standard grouping strategies are now available:

  • Strategy 1 groups items based on selectable criterial, for example, identical position number, material number, substitutes, model unit effectivity, and selection conditions.
  • Strategy 2 adds the group ID to the criteria of strategy 1.

 

Moreover, item grouping for classic bills of material has also been enhanced: You can now use the BAdI /PLMF/BD_SV_CUST_GROUPING to define your own, custom grouping criteria for the grouping of structure version items when creating an SAP classic BOM. Decide if you want to group classic BOM line items, for example, by position number and material number, or by the criteria you have defined via this BAdI. Enjoy this new flexibility and improve the quality of your master data, for more transparency and consistency.

 

What Else is New in PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA?

Besides the innovations above, we further improved your trusted PLMSI add-on to deliver you a range of new functions. Enjoy!

Improved Usability of the PLMSI Workbench

The usability of the PLMSI Workbench has been enhanced with new features: The new Search by Objects function lets you display Domain Model (DM) objects as the leading entity in your searches. You can search based on DM object type, business ID, or use the dynamic search help for suggestions. You can also filter search results by communication direction, DM request types, and object status.

A new Reload button in the toolbar updates selected data and adds new data that meets the initial selection criteria, without closing the current screen.

A new Enable Filter on Errors button in the toolbar allows you to filter entities in the tree based on their error status.

Business Content

As for each feature pack, we have updated our comprehensive set of business content (BC) sets to help you configure your system with ease. For details, see Initial Configuration.

For a comprehensive list of our new and enhanced features for release 3.0 FP03, check out our What's New Viewer. Please make sure to select the latest version 3.0 FP03 to filter for the most recent updates.

Expand Your Range

We are happy and proud that two members of our PLM system integration family have released new versions of their product:

PLM system integration, add-on for Autodesk Vault has published its new version 3.1. Check out the Release Notes (English) and Release Notes (German) to find out about all the new features.

PLM system integration, add-on for 3DEXPERIENCE has also published its new version, 3.2. To find out what is in it for you, refer to the Release Notes.

All relevant information on PLM system integration is also available via the links below.

  • SAP Help Portal
    • Documentation of PLM system integration for SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Product Availability Matrix (SAP login required):
    • Matrix for PLM system integration 3.0 for SAP S/4HANA
  • SAP Roadmap Explorer:
    • SAP Roadmap for PLM system integration

And last but not least – contact us via our excellent forum if you have any questions.

entry.title: Re: Cannot Perform MIGO After Changing and Restoring PO R...
entry.content:
Hi, Sir. Thank you.

We’ve investigated the issue regarding the inability to perform MIGO after a release strategy configuration change. It turns out that the affected PO contains service items, so instead of MIGO, the process should go through transaction ML81N.

For POs with material items, the release strategy configuration has already been reverted to the previous state, and MIGO can now be performed successfully.

However, there are still some outstanding POs that haven't been processed for goods receipt yet.

What is the best practice when changing a PO release strategy, especially considering that:

Some POs have already been released before the change.

Some are partially processed (e.g., not yet GR-ed).

There are service and material items involved.

Should we:

Complete all pending GRs before making release strategy changes?

Close or cancel old POs?

Or is there a safer way to migrate or transition the release strategy?

entry.title: Are Feature-Rich Adapters the Missing Link for AI-Driven Integration Automation?
entry.content:
Introduction

This article presents a thought process that may seem bold, but it is grounded in how AI is expected to evolve in the integration space. AI is rapidly transforming how enterprises design, deploy, and maintain system integrations. With the rise of AI-assisted tools and integration copilot features, there's growing momentum around automating iFlow generation, endpoint configuration, and data mapping. However, the effectiveness of AI in this space heavily depends on the capabilities of the underlying adapters.

Adapters that are limited in scope and offload key responsibilities to the runtime force developers (or AI engines) to manipulate BTP Integration Suite artifacts like scripts, headers, message mappings, or conditional flows. In contrast, adapters like those from Advantco are feature-rich by design and self-sufficient, enabling true automation and reducing complexity in AI-generated integration flows.

The Role of Adapters in AI-Driven Integration

In a traditional integration landscape, adapters were just connectivity endpoints. But in an AI-driven world, they become critical enablers for automation. AI models can only generate integrations as far as the platform components allow:

  • Declarative configuration = easy for AI to reason with
  • Code/script dependencies = difficult for AI to generate and maintain

When adapters encapsulate complexity (e.g., pagination, token handling, retry logic), AI tools can focus on flow orchestration rather than implementation detail.

The Advantage of Advantco Adapters: Design for Autonomy

All of Advantco's adapters (REST, Kafka, SFTP, Salesforce, Google Cloud, and more) are built with the principle that adapters should handle core integration responsibilities internally. This includes:

  • Advanced authentication: OAuth2 (all flows), JWT, mTLS, SAML, API Key, Cookie, Session, etc.
  • Retry logic and error inspection: Based on status codes and payload patterns
  • Header and query manipulation: Without Groovy scripting or BTP runtime logic
  • Pagination and looping: With JSONPath extraction and chaining, configured declaratively
  • Streaming, compression, and multipart handling
  • Connection testing and runtime diagnostics in adapter UI
  • Content conversion: Seamless transformation between JSON, XML, CSV, Avro, Parquet, and Protobuff

This minimizes the need for BTP Integration Suite-specific workarounds, expression mappings, or error subprocesses.

Why This Matters for AI and Automation

AI can only automate what is predictable and declarative.

Adapters that require runtime message mappings or Groovy scripting introduce branching logic that:

  • Is hard for AI to generate accurately
  • Requires post-generation developer intervention
  • Reduces the value of low-code/no-code automation

In contrast, feature-rich adapters allow AI to:

  • Automatically generate end-to-end iFlows
  • Map endpoints using OpenAPI specs or schema introspection
  • Configure pagination, security, and error recovery with minimal prompts
  • Perform content conversion (e.g., JSON ↔ XML) seamlessly within the adapter
  • Handle multi-step API processes (e.g., Salesforce Bulk API) without custom orchestration

This makes AI-generated flows production-ready rather than just a starting point.

Real-World Example:

REST API with Token Pagination and OAuth2

A typical enterprise scenario involves:

  • OAuth2 authentication with token refresh
  • Paginated data retrieval via nextPageToken
  • Retry on non-standard error codes

In the SAP standard HTTP adapter, this would require:

  • Groovy scripts for OAuth
  • Message mappings for token chaining
  • Condition logic for retries

In the Advantco REST adapter:

  • All handled via adapter configuration
  • AI can configure the integration entirely from the OpenAPI spec

Business Value:
Enables full automation of paginated and secured REST API consumption without scripts. Reduces manual coding, increases reliability, and accelerates delivery of production-ready flows.

Kafka Event Stream Integration

Many organizations use Kafka to stream real-time events (e.g., transactions, telemetry, logs) to or from SAP. Common requirements include:

  • Schema registry support (e.g., Avro, JSON Schema)
  • Header injection and dynamic topic routing
  • Confluent or MSK OAuth2-based authentication

Using the standard KAFKA adapter, this often requires:

  • Custom logic for key deserialization
  • Workarounds for offset handling or partitioning

With the Advantco Kafka adapter:

  • Native support for schema registry integration
  • Built-in content conversion between XML, JSON, Avro
  • Support for header-based routing, retry, and long-polling

Business Value:
Supports scalable, real-time event streaming with minimal configuration. Reduces the need for custom coding in high-throughput environments and simplifies schema evolution.

Salesforce Bulk API Integration

Enterprises integrating with Salesforce often use the Salesforce Bulk API to process large data sets efficiently (e.g., leads, contacts, orders). Key requirements include:

  • OAuth2 login
  • Batching records into CSV or JSON format
  • Managing job status and polling until completion

In a typical integration with the standard Salesforce, this would require:

  • Multiple iFlow steps for batch creation, status check, and result retrieval
  • Custom logic for job ID correlation and polling intervals

With the Advantco Salesforce adapter:

  • Native support for Salesforce Bulk API operations
  • Built-in polling and job monitoring
  • Automatic job ID tracking and result extraction

Business Value:
Streamlines high-volume data processing with native polling, batching, and job tracking. Eliminates orchestration complexity, making it ideal for AI-driven integration tools.

Conclusion

As SAP Integration Suite evolves toward AI-assisted and low-code paradigms, the role of adapters becomes more strategic than ever. Adapters that encapsulate integration logic internally unlock the full potential of AI-driven automation by removing the need for runtime scripting, error subprocesses, and manual fine-tuning.

In this sense, feature-rich adapters like those from Advantco are indeed the missing link—filling the gap between AI-generated integration design and real-world execution.

entry.title: Re: Introducing the new pipeline concept in Cloud Integration
entry.content:
@philippeaddor in order to reduce the number of JMS queues there was no other possibility than to combine JMS adapter with ProcessDirect Adaper, if we used JMS overall we would have ended up with far too many JMS queues again, so this approach is a compromise between limited resources and operation. ProcessDirect is sync and hence failed integration flows remain in failed status, however to mitigate this monitoring situation the integration flows which are called via ProcessDirect have a custom status indicating that restart is done via the calling integration flows. One option to reduce the number of logs in error status would be to switch off the logging for those integration flows which are called via ProcessDirect because the error message is shown in the calling integration flow anyway.

Wrt monitoring enhancements that I mentioned, I guess I referred to enhancements of the JMS queue monitor that we plan to ship hopefully soon, so the option to filter messages in the queues and to move selected messages instead of all.

Btw, due to the shortcomings of the JMS queue monitoring, a new community package has been recently shipped that allows you to use data stores as dead letter storage instead of a dead letter queue, see https://community.sap.com/t5/integration-blog-posts/process-integration-pipeline-extension-restart-via-data-store/ba-p/14153116

Alex

entry.title: Re: EOIO in SAP CI Using JMS - Exclusive Mode
entry.content:
@Arindam you can't have full flexibility, the queues are not created during runtime, they are created when deploying an integration flow, if you use dynamic queues for all JMS adapters and the resolved queue doesn't exist during runtime then the message will fail, so as far as I know on the sender side you need a fix queue name anyway, on the receiver side headers or properties should be supported.

Alex

entry.title: Re: SAP Badge has not been issued after SAP Certification...
entry.content:
Hi Abhinash,

To help resolve the digital badge issue, please check if you’ve added two email addresses to your SAP Universal ID. Both emails should be from different domains (for example, one could be a Gmail address and the other from Yahoo or Outlook). Using two emails from the same domain can sometimes cause problems with badge issuance.
Please review your Universal ID settings and update the addresses if needed—this has helped others in similar situations.
Hope this helps!

entry.title: ABAP GEN AI: Accessing LLM Capabilities within ABAP-Stack using ABAP AI SDK powered by ISLM
entry.content:
In the evolving landscape of enterprise AI, SAP’s Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) has emerged as a powerful tool for embedding intelligence into business processes. With the growing adoption of SAP S/4HANA Cloud, ISLM plays an important role in enabling embedded intelligence without the need for heavy custom development. It ensures that AI-driven processes remain agile, compliant, and easy to scale across business functions. 

In this blog, I will guide you through how Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM) streamlines the end-to-end management of AI scenarios within the SAP ecosystem. The blog is structured in below two parts.

  • Part 1: Establishing Connectivity – We’ll explore the fundamentals of ISLM and how it integrates with SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  • Part 2: End-to-End Implementation – We’ll delve into the practical usage of ISLM in the public cloud, leveraging the ABAP AI SDK to demonstrate a complete end-to-end use case

ISLM-Integration with SAP Generative AI-Hub

This section provides a detailed walkthrough of the integration process between ISLM and the Generative AI-Hub in SAP AI Core.

Step 1: Download the Certificate from S/4 Hana Public Cloud

1. Log-on to the SAP Fiori launchpad and choose Maintain Client Certificates

 

2. Choose the Client Default from the certificates list and export the file to the local folder in Base-64-encoded X.509 certificate (.crt) format.

 

Step 2: Create a Service Instance and Key in SAP BTP Cockpit

  1. On the Instances and Subscriptions page, find your new instance that you created and choose Create Service Key from the drop-down.
  2. Enter a name for your service key.
  3. Configure binding properties.
    • Enter Binding Name as SAP_COM_0A69_Skey (any name of your choice).
    • The parameters you need to set when you create your service key or service binding are the following in JSON format:

                     Click Create.

    • Download your service key to save it.

Save the service key details, as these will be required when setting up the communication system and communication arrangement for integrating ISLM with the Generative AI-Hub.

Service Key details --> 

Step 3: Configure Communication System for SAP_COM_0A69 in S/4 HANA Public Cloud

1. Log-on to the SAP Fiori launchpad and open communication system app.

2. Create new communication system and enter System ID and System name.

3. Navigate to the Technical Data tab and update the Technical Data details as per the service key details.

4.For Host Name, use the AI_API_URL value without protocol.

 

Step 4: Outbound OAuth 2.0 Client Settings, configure:

  1. Authorization Endpoint: Use the URL value without protocol.

  2. Token Endpoint: Use the URL value without protocol and append /oauth/token.

  3. mTLS Endpoint: Use the certurl value without protocol, and also append /oauth/token.

 
Step 5. On the Users for Outbound Communication tab, choose the Add button.

  1. Create an authentication method, enter the following details:

    • Authentication Method - Select OAuth 2.0

    • OAuth 2.0 Client ID - Use the clientid value from the service key.

    • Client Authentication - Select mTLS

    • For Client Certificate, select Client Default from the value help.

 

Step 6. Create the Communication Arrangement for SAP_COM_0A69 in S/4 Public cloud.

1) Add the communication system from the drop down created in step 5.

 

2) Save the communication arrangement.

Once the communication system and arrangement are created, we can create an intelligent scenario of type Generative AI in the ABAP development tools for Eclipse.

1) Intelligent Scenario --> 

 2) Intelligent Scenario Model --> 

 

Intelligent Scenario Management App

Published Intelligent Scenarios will be visible here in Intelligent Scenario Management App

 

You can select the Scenario and deploy it.

For more information on Intelligent Scenario please refer below links -->

Introduction to Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Man... - SAP Community

Select an Intelligent Scenario | SAP Help Portal

These topics will be covered in detail in Part 2 of the blog, along with a complete business use case.

Accessing LLM via ABAP AI SDK

Last but very important part of the blog --> Accessing LLM using ABAP AI SDK in eclipse.

The ABAP AI SDK is a reuse library in an ABAP system that provides access to generative AI functionality via Intelligent Scenario Lifecycle Management (ISLM). The SDK provides access to a variety of large language models (LLMs) available on generative AI hub that are exposed via intelligent scenarios.

Use AI SDK to call the LLM.

 

Response of LLM --> 

 
Connection has been successfully established, and now we are able to interact with LLM using ABAP AI SDK.
 
If you found this blog useful, feel free to share your thoughts or questions in the comments below.
 
In Part 2, I will guide you through creating an Intelligent Scenario and Model, along with a real-world business use case demonstrating the full flow.

entry.title: Re: Import sale order App Not working for Return Order
entry.content:
The “Import Sales Orders” app is limited to Document category C and reference-based creation (e.g., from quotations or contracts) and it will not support returns. Not sure, in which version you are working, but for information, SAP introduced a dedicated app called "Import Customer Returns" starting from S/4HANA Cloud 2502.2. However, this app currently supports only document type CBAR, and serial number handling is not yet supported in its Version 2.

Have a look at SAP note 3537575 for more information

entry.title: Using Service Bundles as Subitems of Bundles in Solution Orders
entry.content:
Introduction

In the pursuit of delivering comprehensive solutions to customers, SAP’s latest update for Solution Order Management introduces an advanced feature: Service Bundles, with the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508. This feature allows businesses to seamlessly integrate service products, parts, and expense items into a unified package, thereby improving customer experience and operational efficiency. Compared with service bundles within service orders, solution orders offer automatic exploration of service bundles when you use service bundles as subitems of bundle items. That's based on the Bill of Material (BOM) technology of the product master. In this blog, let's explore the steps for using a service bundle within a solution order as a bundle subitem.

Step-by-Step Instructions for Using Service Bundles in Solution Orders 

You can follow the following three steps to realize the automatic explosion of service bundles in solution orders.

  1. Create BOM master data for service bundle
  2. Create BOM master data for bundle item in solution orders
  3. Use the service bundle in a solution order

Step 1: Create BOM master data for service bundle

1.1 Create the product for the service bundle

Open the  "Manage Product Master Data" app (ID: F1602) to create the product DEMO_SRV_BUNDLE. Ensure you have the necessary permissions or roles (SAP_BR_PRODMASTER_SPECIALIST) assigned to access this app.

Please note:

  • The item category group should be SVBV or SVBL, see more details here .
  • The product is created in the plant 1710.
  • For further details regarding creating product, see here.

1.2 Open the "Maintain Bill of Material" app (ID: F1813)

Ensure you have the necessary permissions or roles (SAP_BR_BOM_ENGINEER) assigned to access this app.

1.3 Enter basic BOM information

Click on "Create BOM". In the popup, enter the required fields, such as Plant, BOM usage (Sales and Distribution), and Material (DEMO_SRV_BUNDLE created from Step 1.1). Note that the BOM master data must also be created in plant 1710.  

1.4 Add BOM components

Proceed to list all components that will be part of the BOM. For each item, specify Material, Quantity, Unit of Measure, Item Category, etc. The component should consist of products that can serve as subitems within a service bundle, as described here. 

1.5 Define BOM header

According to your business requirements, input information in the BOM header section, such as BOM Description, Base Quantity, etc. 

Now, you can complete the creation process by saving the BOM. 

Step 2 Create BOM master data for bundle item

In this step, you can set up the BOM master data for the bundle item to be used in solution orders. This bundle item can include a service bundle as its subitem.  

2.1 Create the product for solution order bundle item

Open the app "Manage Product Master Data" as a product master specialist. Create a product DEMO_SOLUTION_BUNDLE that can be used as the bundle item in solution orders (we call this kind of product "bundle product"). Ensure the product is configurable and plant 1710 is maintained for the product.  

2.2 Create configuration profile

As a product master specialist, develop a configuration profile for the bundle product DEMO_SOLUTION_BUNDLE using the "Create Configuration Profile" app. Set the Processing Mode to "Advanced Variant Configuration", BOM Application to "SD01", and the Process to "Sales Order (SET)". 

 

2.3 Create BOM for the bundle product and include the service bundle

As a BOM engineer, go to the "Maintain Bill of Material" app (ID: F1813). Create BOM for the product DEMO_SOLUTION_BUNDLE. Use the same attributes: plant 1710, BOM usage "5 Sales and Distribution". In this BOM, you can add components. In this case, we add one service contract product and one service bundle.  

Step 3 Use bundle products and service bundles in solution orders

3.1 Create a solution order

Open the "Manage Solution Orders" app (F4615) as a solution order specialist (Role: SAP_BR_SOLN_ORDER_SPCLST). Fill in necessary information, such as sold-to party, etc. Set the sales organization to 1710.  

3.2 Add bundle item

Add an item using the bundle product DEMO_SOLUTION_BUNDLE, where plant 1710 will be automatically determined. Then the bundle item is exploded automatically. The service bundle included in this bundle item is exploded as well, as the subitem of the bundle item.  

Conclusion

In this blog, we explained how to use service bundles in the bundle items in solution orders in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. We hope you can try this out in your own system by following the steps. If you have any questions about the topic, feel free to ask questions in Q&A forum of SAP Community or leave your comments below.

entry.title: Announcing the SAP Analytics Cloud Home Page Redesign
entry.content:
At SAP, we're always looking for ways to make your experience better, more efficient, and more enjoyable. That’s why I'm thrilled to introduce our Redesigned SAP Analytics Cloud Home Page for the 2025 Q3 QRC release.

What is the New SAC Home Page?

The new SAC Home Page is designed to help you navigate and access key resources more seamlessly. With this updated interface, you can now enjoy a more intuitive layout, enhanced customization options, and improved performance for a smoother experience. 

Why You’ll Love It

Here are just a few reasons why the new SAC Home Page is a game-changer:

  • Enhanced Usability: Streamlined navigation makes it easier to find what you need, when you need it.

  • Personalized Experience: Customize your SAC Home page to prioritize the tools and insights most relevant to you.

  • Faster Performance: Optimized loading times ensure a more efficient workflow.

A total of five new cards are being introduced to the SAC home page. Let's take a closer look at them.

Onboarding Card

It provides a brand new onboarding experience. It includes links to helpful tutorials and learning courses, so you can get up to speed with the product in no time.

The card also comes with a search bar where you can type in questions you might have directly. It will lead you to our help documentation with the most fitting results for your query.

Quick Actions Card

It lets you select up to four quick actions from a broad selection, to add to your home page, for quick access to your most frequent daily tasks like creating a story or a model.

Just Ask Card

What's also new is that Just Ask now comes as a card with an advanced search bar. Powered by generative AI, it lets you initiate searches from the home page using natural language.

Not only does it let you enter your search, but it also lets you refine it by selecting your data and adding attributes. The Just Ask feature then opens and pre-populates your search from the card with results.

Resources Card

To help you explore our community, see upcoming updates, and learn more about SAC roadmap, we've created the Resources card.

This card provides quick and easy access to various types of information about the product. You can find everything from a sample custom widgets to business content, release updates, and more.

Favourites Card

The final card we'd like to introduce is the Favourites card. It displays files you've favourited and allows you to filter them.

You can find the filter settings in the card's submenu. The dialog lets you filter by all file types and you can choose to apply one or multiple filters for the card.

Besides all of our new cards, we've also improved and revamped some of our existing cards, which are : 

  • Calendar highlights
  • Recent files
  • Featured files
  • and Data Change Insights

The cards all come with search functions and improved filtering experiences and capabilities. So you can display and find the information you're looking for easily.

How to Customize it 

All of our cards are repositionable, and the card layout is responsive. If you decide to reposition a card, all the other cards will adjust accordingly. For further customization, you can open the home page settings dialog. It's still available via the user profile. However, for quicker access, we've added a "Customize" button to the top right area of the home page.

The home page settings dialog provides you with the option to select your default home page experience and show and hide functions for all the available cards.

What's next ?

Within the next releases we will introduce:

  • New cards
  • Enable the card Resizing 
  • Introducing cards dedicated to the SAC Administrator 
  • New user profile settings
  • New Theming features 

Stay tuned for more updates !

entry.title: Missing Sales Order Reference after integration to S4 in OBP
entry.content:
Hello Community,

we are currently facing a challenge with order-based planning (OBP) using SAP IBP and S/4HANA (Make-to-Order process).

Scenario (short version):

  • In S/4, we create a material with MTO strategy and enter a sales order.

  • The sales order is correctly visible in IBP (e.g., Projected Stock App).

  • After the planning run, IBP creates a planned order, which is still assigned to the sales order in the IBP analysis screen.

  • When we transfer the planned order from IBP to S/4, it also shows up in S/4 (e.g., transaction MD04).

  • The issue: In S/4, the planned order transferred from IBP does not show any reference to the original sales order in the “Assignment” tab – this information is missing.

What we have already done:

  • We have enhanced ZCIF_ORDER_MAP_IBP_MTO to handle MTO orders correctly.

  • RTI connection S/4 ↔ IBP is working, orders are transferred, and the basic flow works.

Question to the community:
How can the reference to the original sales order be preserved when transferring planned orders from IBP to S/4HANA? Is there a best practice, BAdI, user exit, mapping option, or any other approach to transfer this information?
Any feedback, tips, or experience would be appreciated .

Thanks and best regards,
Oli

entry.title: Joule功能全景介绍：Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的核心功能与应用
entry.content:
在快速变化的商业环境中，效率和智能化是企业成功的关键。SAP的智能副驾驶Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中扮演重要角色，旨在通过自然语言交互帮助用户高效完成任务、获取信息和管理业务对象。本文将深入探讨Joule的关键功能及其应用场景。

Joule不仅是聊天机器人，更是能理解用户意图、协助完成复杂业务流程的智能助手。其核心能力分为五类：信息查询、应用导航，事务处理，分析功能以及代理功能。

 

以下将为您深入介绍Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的主要功能及其核心应用场景：

 

​​• 导航功能 (Navigational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule帮助用户定位与任务最相关的应用程序。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 用户可通过描述需执行任务或查找对象向Joule提出请求。Joule提供导航至常用应用程序的建议。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “我在哪个应用中可以创建采购订单？”
    • “如何上传供应商发票？”
    • “查找用于分析日记账分录的应用”
    • “在哪里可以为物料AB0123创建采购订单？”
    • “显示用于定义‘咨询’活动的成本率的应用”
  • ​​前提条件​​: 访问Joule建议的应用需用户拥有相应的业务目录权限。

​​• 信息功能 (Informational Capability)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule通过分析总结SAP帮助门户信息，提供简洁、有依据的问题答案。其评估问题，检索相关文章，利用大型语言模型分析并总结结果，提供相关文章链接。
  • ​​应用场景​​: 对话中获取关于应用程序、产品功能等查询的有依据回复。

  • ​​示例问题​​:
    • “什么是免费销售订单？”
    • “服务订单和服务合同之间有什么区别？”
    • “如何配置采购订单的灵活工作流？”
  • ​​额外功能​​: Joule可引导用户至相关应用或在需要时代为执行操作。

​​• 事务处理功能 (Transactional Capabilities)​​

  • ​​作用​​: Joule使您能够访问后端系统并管理业务任务。您可以在对话中直接查看和处理业务对象，而无需离开对话界面并执行操作，从而简化工作流程并减少获取洞察所需的时间。

                  

  • 应用场景
    • 查看业务数据 (Viewing Business Data)​​:
      • 无需打开相关应用，您可以在Joule聊天窗口中直接显示业务对象详细数据,比如要求Joule显示如采购订单状态、采购申请项目等详细信息。
      • 目前该模式已支持采购订单、销售订单、供应商发票、检验方法、主检验特性、流程订单等共计34类业务对象（完整列表详见帮助文档）
      • 示例问题：
      • 显示逾期采购订单项
      • 显示尚未交货的销售订单​
      • 获取计划开始日期为2026年的生产订单
      • 获取我创建的生产订单确认

 

    • ​​创建洞察卡 (Creating Insights Cards)​​:
      • 该功能支持您在Joule输入查询后，显示列表和洞察的快照，用户满意可将卡片添加至“我的主页”
      • 支持的应用示例有：供应商发票列表（版本2）、管理采购订单（版本2）、管理销售订单、维护物料清单、查找维护订单、管理采购申请等。

 

    • 财务领域：创建固定资产主数据 (Creating Fixed Asset Master Data)​​:
  • 该功能支持您在Joule内创建固定资产主数据记录。
  • 您可以要求Joule创建单个资产主记录，并提供公司代码、成本中心、资产类别及可选资产描述。当信息不全时，Joule会引导创建过程，请求补充信息。
  • 示例对话：
    • 用户：“请创建一个固定资产”
    • Joule: 请提供以下信息公司代码（Company Code）,资产类别（Asset Class）,成本中心（Cost Center）资产描述（Asset Description）
    • 用户提供详情如“1010, 3200, 10101041, 笔记本电脑ABC”。

 

 

  • ​​销售领域：检查和续订即将到期的价格 (Renew Expiring Prices)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助您管理即将到期的价格（存储为销售定价条件记录），您可以要求Joule查询即将到期价格，按日期/时间范围过滤。可延长有效期至新日期或延长一段时间（如30天、一周、三个季度或一年），也可按百分比调整条件金额或比率。
    • 示例请求：“显示2025年5月1日到期的PPR0和PCP0条件类型的价格”、“延长有效日期一个月并调整条件金额-10%”

 

  • ​​销售订单状态检查 (Sales Order Status Check)​​:
    • 该功能可以帮助销售代表或经理检查销售订单履行状态，识别阻碍问题。如存在问题，Joule可显示问题数量、最早到期日、可能原因、处理建议等，并可打开相关销售订单应用。
    • 示例请求：“销售订单12345的状态是什么？”、“销售订单12345有什么问题吗？”

 

  • 代理能力 (Agentic Capabilities)
    • 作用：Joule能够自主地与环境互动，并通过多步任务迭代推理以实现目标，具备规划、反思、工具使用以及协作和多代理等关键能力。您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看代理功能的具体落地日期。
  • 分析能力 (Analytical Capabilities)
    • Joule也将在未来版本中提供基于业务数据的分析能力，能够为用户提供见解。这部分的功能尚在开发中，您可以关注SAP 的产品路线图来查看有关分析功能的最新信息。

​​Joule的技术架构与访问要求​​


Joule作为独立软件组件，通过 ​​SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)​​ 以 ​​SaaS（软件即服务）​​ 形式管理和更新，支持集中式设置，实现跨连接应用的统一用户体验。

​​许可和授权：要访问SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中的Joule，可能需要额外的许可和授权。建议咨询您的SAP客户经理以获取更多信息。

业务目录要求：为了能够访问Joule提议的应用程序或使用其特定功能，您的用户需要被分配相应的业务目录（business catalogs）。

 

Joule的未来与扩展性

Joule目前支持以11种语言显示工作内容，未来还将支持更多语言。

 Joule还具备强大的可扩展性，允许通过自定义技能、低代码平台和第三方连接进行扩展。Joule studio在SAP Build中提供，助力您根据特定需求扩展Joule的功能。

更值得一提的是，Joule的AI辅助文档接地 (Document Grounding)功能，能够结合推理能力，利用您自己的非结构化或半结构化文档（如HR政策文档）来回答用户问题。它通过将大型语言模型 (LLM) 与高级信息检索相结合，增强响应质量和准确性，最大程度地减少“幻觉”，并建立信任、减少歧义。

Joule在SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition中，不仅仅是一个工具，更是一个智能化的业务搭档。它将繁琐的导航、信息查找和部分事务处理任务，转化为直观的自然语言对话，极大地提升了用户体验和工作效率。

感谢阅读。

entry.title: Re: SAP ABAP RAP : Custom Entities with compositions relationship in a Fiori Elements App
entry.content:
Hi,

Adding this comment for anyone facing the following issue:

  • Parent entity is showing up correctly.
  • On selecting a record, (to navigate to object page showing child entity), the parent entity logic is triggered twice.
  • System never processes the child entity logic. App throws a "short_dump" message.

Solution:

  • During navigation operation, when parent entity is called, it should fill the IO_RESPONSE with exactly 1 record.
  • This record should contain the value for fields used is Child entity for the 'To Parent' association.

Example based on the objects created/used in this blog:

Child entity is using field 'ShipReqNo' for association. So, this field should be filled when navigation logic (for parent entity) is called.

define custom entity ZRK_CE_I_ShipReqItem 
{
     ...
      _ShipReq : association to parent ZRK_CE_I_ShipReq 
        on $projection.ShipReqNo = _ShipReq.ShipReqNo ; 
}

For us, the during navigation, the below IF conditions were returning 'false' and thus no data was being written to the IO_RESPONSE object.

    CASE io_request->get_entity_id( ).
      WHEN 'ZRK_CE_I_SHIPREQ'.
        ...
        IF io_request->is_data_requested( ).
          io_response->set_data( lt_shipreq_resp ).
        ENDIF.
        IF io_request->is_total_numb_of_rec_requested( ).
          io_response->set_total_number_of_records( lines( lt_shipreq_resp ) ).
        ENDIF.
        ...

 Once we changed the logic to fill the association field ('ShipReqNo' - only 1 entry) during navigation, the system started calling child entity logic. 

Thanks

entry.title: What causes a CAP projection on a DB entity to fail after accessing an external OData V2 service?
entry.content:
I have a CAP Node.js project that exposes a single service containing both:

  • Projections on local database tables

  • Projections on an external OData V2 service (via EDMX)

service BookingService {
  entity BookingStatuses as projection on my.db.ValueHelp;
  entity HCMBookingRequestView as projection on External.RequestViewSet
     {
      ..
      ..
      code,
      status: Association to ValueHelps on ValueHelps.code= code
     }
  }

What is happening?

  •  I first access BookingService/BookingStatuses → works fine.

  • Then I access BookingService/HCMBookingRequestView → also works.

  •  Then I again access BookingService/BookingStatuses → Fails with:

    Error: Target BookingService.BookingStatuses cannot be resolved for service SAP_HCM

What could be causing this?

  • What makes CAP think that BookingStatuses belongs to the SAP_HCM external service?

  • How is service context resolution managed internally in CAP when both local and remote projections are used in the same service?

  • What should I check to prevent CAP from mixing up DB and external projections?

  • How can I isolate or reset the context so that local projections are always correctly resolved?

  • What’s the best practice for mixing projections on DB and remote services in the same CAP service?

Setup Details

  • CAP version: @SAP/cds 8.9.4

  • External service: SAP_HCM (OData V2, connected via EDMX + destination)

  • Local DB: SQLite (dev), HANA (prod)

Any help or guidance on how to resolve this or how to structure services to avoid this would be greatly appreciated!

entry.title: Unexpected Behavior with Team Filter in Peform Maintenance Jobs
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I’m encountering an issue with team management in  the "Manage Teams and Responsibilities for Work Centers" tile.

Context:

I’ve created a team using this app and assigned members to work centers. However, this setup has no impact on the filters used to view jobs associated with a team.

SAP Documentation:

According to the official documentation:

"If no work center has been specified in the Personalization app, the system considers the team defined in the Manage Teams and Responsibilities app."
(SAP Help Documentation)

So, in theory, if no default value is set in the Personalization app, the system should rely on the team definition from Manage Teams and Responsibilities. However, this doesn’t seem to work as expected:

  • If I use the Personalization App to set a Work Center, the job filter reacts properly.

  • If I remove the personalization and rely only on the team setup, no jobs appear.

Hypothesis and Question:

I’ve noticed that when HR assignments are made directly at the work center level, the jobs are displayed correctly.

This raises a few questions:

  • Are the teams defined in Manage Teams and Responsibilities (type MAINT_TEAM) implicitly or necessarily linked to HR data or should the job filter work without relying on HR assignments?

  • Is there a configuration step or mapping needed between MAINT_TEAM and HR objects (e.g., position, person, organizational unit)?

Thank you in advance for your insights or any experience you can share on this!

Best regards

entry.title: Re: Issue with Adopt UI – "Publish" Button Disabled for C...
entry.content:
Hi,

You may not have a correct transport setup in your development environment. This is the most likely cause. 

Beyond that, you can try the following steps:

  1. Verify Custom Field Configuration:

    • Ensure your "User Remarks" custom field in the Sales Document context is properly configured in the Custom Fields and Logic app
    • Confirm the field is published and active

  2. Check UI Enablement Settings:

    • In the Custom Fields and Logic app, navigate to the "UIs and Reports" tab for your custom field
    • Verify that all relevant UI options are enabled, particularly those related to sales order processing and workflow scenarios

  3. Follow Proper UI Adaptation Sequence:

    • Access the Manage Sales Orders app in adaptation mode
    • When adding the custom field, ensure you complete the full adaptation process:
      • Right-click the appropriate UI container and select "Add: Field"
      • Select your "User Remarks" field from the Available Contents menu
      • The "Activate New Version" button should become available after successfully adding the field

  4. Activation and Publishing Process:

    • Click "Activate New Version" first to activate the current draft
    • Provide a meaningful version name when prompted
    • Only after successful activation should the "Publish Version" button become available

Best regards, Dequan Xu

entry.title: 移动设备故事设计的最佳实践指南
entry.content:
介绍

借助SAP分析云，设计人员和开发人员在创建故事时可以使用大量灵活的功能。然而，考虑这些复杂的故事可能对​​移动设备​​中的用户体验和运行性能产生的影响是十分重要的。

​​在本篇博客中，我们将重点介绍一些最佳实践指南，供设计人员和开发人员在为移动设备创作故事时参考。

最佳实践

为了提供流畅且用户友好的体验，设计人员和开发人员可以参考一些最佳实践指南。这些指南可分为三部分：

  • 理解移动设备硬件规格
  • 故事简化（对象与高级特性）​
  • 移动设备上的测试与验证

理解移动设备硬件规格

设计人员和开发人员应该熟悉SAP分析云的移动硬件规格。这是因为根据整个业务中可用的设备，应遵循不同的最佳实践指南。以下是每个设备的一些推荐的最佳实践指南：

设备内存大小（iPad和iPhone）

最大页面数量（推荐）

iPad 单页单元权重总量（推荐）

iPhone 单页单元权重总量（推荐）

3GB

3

2.5

2.5

4GB

4

3.0

2.5

6GB

5

4.0

2.5

8GB

7

4.5

3.5

16GB 

10

5.0

N/A

故事简化（对象与高级特性）​

设计人员和开发人员应该了解在移动设备上向消费者展示哪些信息是重要的。因为与笔记本电脑不同，移动设备的屏幕尺寸和设备内存有限。

技巧1. 降低仪表盘整体复杂度​

从便利性角度出发，将所有信息整合至单一故事颇具吸引力。然而，此举可能导致​​信息过载​​，并​​使移动设备体验复杂化​​。因为页面数量与对象的组合会增加故事大小，进而导致运行处理时间的增加。

注意：当与设计数据相关的小部件数量和页面数量超过建议数量时，设计时会发出警告。

  • · 限制单页上数据相关小部件的数量：建议将这些内容分散到多个页面中。对于流式布局面板或响应式布局，可以使用响应规则配置来根据设备隐藏特定的小部件。
  • 限制故事页的数量：建议同时限制单个故事板内的页面总数。创建更精简的故事，并利用​​故事之间的超链接​​实现跨故事导航。

技巧2. 限制“高消耗”可视化对象的数量

鉴于移动设备内存普遍低于Web端，且不同移动设备内存容量差异显著，​​因此严格控制内存密集型微件的数量十分重要​​。各微件类型的单位权重值详情可参阅SAP帮助门户文档。

以下为高消耗微件示例：

  • ​​地理可视化对象​​
    • ​​表
    • ​​时间序列统计图​​
    • ​​自定义微件

注意：对于​​地理可视化对象，还有进一步的建议，即​​每页至多包含一个​​地理可视化对象​​，​​且在该可视化对象中限制图层数（不超过三个）。

注意：一个故事中筛选器的数量能会影响移动设备上的性能

技巧3. 限制复杂脚本的使用

使用优化体验，有许多可用的 API，允许开发者创建开箱即用的自定义应用或工作流，这意味着低效的脚本或复杂的脚本会对移动设备体验产生影响，原因在于其会增大处理负载并引发移动设备闪退。

在各种移动设备上进行测试和验证

​注意：以上提示均属最佳实践指南。鉴于移动设备硬件配置差异显著，必须逐台验证使用体验。

技巧1. 预览和测试

故事中的设备预览功能是验证多设备适配效果的实用工具，但若需确保界面响应灵敏、体验流畅易用，物理设备预览与测试环节依然至关重要。

技巧2. 性能和内存验证

作为技巧1的扩展，侧重点在于​​要求跨多种设备的（如3, 4, 6, 8+ GB内存），对故事进行充分测试​​。这能为用户​​规避内存溢出（OOM）问题提供额外保障​​。

结论

借助这些最佳实践指南，设计人员和开发人员将能够优化他们的故事以供移动设备使用，确保流畅且用户友好的体验

随着 SAP分析云的 2024 年第四季度(Q4)季度发布更新(QRC)​​，SAC移动设备iOS应用将对兼容的故事启用精简版查看器。该技术将​​显著降低在移动设备上打开故事时的运行内存消耗​​。

原文链接：Best Practice Guide for Designing Stories for Mobi... - SAP Community

原作者：Kapil, Tunir

entry.title: How to retrieve multiple tables at once using SAP Gateway Service Builder
entry.content:
Using SAP Gateway Service Builder, I am implementing Association and GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET methods based on the following article.

https://www.sapyard.com/odata-and-sap-netweaver-gateway-part-iv-association-and-navigation-in-odata-service/
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hTNclt8sM2c
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K0yuFRQRygY&list=PLl_MEz33D2N0NvudI_oxOuRW5XMamXe5l&index=28

In the article, both the retrieval of the Principal table (TABLE1) and the Dependent table (TABLE2) are described using GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET. However,
when I actually execute the API with $expand, GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET is executed multiple times.
The retrieval of Principal data is successful, but I am unable to retrieve Dependent data.
Please tell me the correct implementation method for GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET.
Also, is it normal for GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET to be executed multiple times with a single API execution?


The following is other information.

・sourcecode

DATA: BEGIN OF ts_deep_entity.
INCLUDE TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>ts_table1.
DATA: table2Set TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>tt_table2,
END OF ts_deep_entity.

DATA:it_deep_entity LIKE TABLE OF ts_deep_entity,
wa_deep_entity LIKE LINE OF it_deep_entity.
DATA: it_info TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>tt_table1,
it_item TYPE /<package>/<mpc>=>tt_table2.

CASE IV_ENTITY_SET_NAME.
WHEN 'table1Set'.
SELECT * FROM /<package>/table1
INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_deep_entity.
LOOP AT it_deep_entity INTO wa_deep_entity.
SELECT * FROM /<package>/table2 INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF TABLE @IT_item.
" WHERE parentid= @its_deep_entity-id.
MOVE-CORRESPONDING it_item TO wa_deep_entity-table2Set.
ENDLOOP.

CALL METHOD me->/iwbep/if_mgw_conv_srv_runtime~copy_data_to_ref
EXPORTING
is_data = it_deep_entity
CHANGING
cr_data = ER_ENTITYSET.
WHEN 'table2Set'.

• When checking the value of IV_ENTITY_SET_NAME in the debugger,
the first execution returns the Principal EntitySet value, and subsequent executions return the Dependent EntitySet value.
Additionally, GET_EXPANDED_ENTITYSET is executed once for each row in the Principal table (Table1) plus one extra execution.

entry.title: Re: Canadian Tax Subcondition Type - SD
entry.content:
Table A053 stores condition records for taxes using jurisdiction codes, including condition types like JRC1–JRC4. In systems with “Test Data” enabled, SAP preloads this table with jurisdiction codes and tax rates, allowing automatic tax determination—even for manually configured condition types. Without test data, A053 is empty, so the system can’t find matching records unless you create them manually.

As you would know, each condition type (e.g. JRC1) must be assigned an access sequence that includes table A053. To check this access sequence, go to V/07 and verify that the access sequence for JRC1–JRC4 includes A053. If it is missing, you can create a new one and add A053. If you created a new access sequence and added A053, ensure that you assigned this new access sequence to A053 in v/06. Finally, maintain condition record in vk11 so that, A053 will populate with the necessary entries.

entry.title: Join Us at SAP Connect 2025 – October 6–8 in Las Vegas!
entry.content:
We’re excited to invite you to SAP Connect 2025, taking place from October 6–8, 2025, in Las Vegas, Nevada. 

This new flagship event brings together business leaders, line-of-business practitioners, data experts, and SAP partners for three inspiring days of innovation, insights, and meaningful exchange — all centered around the power of integrated business transformation. 

What is SAP Connect? 

SAP Connect replaces former solution-specific events like SAP Spend Connect Live and SAP SuccessConnect, bringing them together under one unified umbrella — but with a clear solution area focus: 

  • Sessions are organized into five dedicated solution tracks (e.g., procurement, HR, finance, data & analytics), 
  • Each track is tailored to the needs of its audience and physically separated for depth and relevance, 
  • Keynotes will bring everyone together, while breakouts stay close to your day-to-day challenges and opportunities. 

This is a solution-led event, designed to help organizations explore how SAP technologies drive real-world business outcomes. 
 

Why Attend?

entry.title: Re: Delivery should not be Invoiced
entry.content: Configuration Options Business Rule Setup Configure delivery date requirements through transaction rules. You can set up rules that require delivery dates for order confirmations and ship notices [1]. When enabled, suppliers must provide delivery dates on order confirmations and ship notices before proceeding with billing processes. Validation Rule Implementation Implement validation rules that check delivery date fields before allowing invoice creation. The system can be configured to prevent invoice processing when required delivery information is missing [1]. Technical Implementation Approaches User Exit Enhancement Create a user exit or enhancement point that validates the delivery document before posting. This would involve: Adding validation logic to check if the Actual Date field is populated Preventing the billing process from continuing if the validation fails Displaying appropriate error messages to guide users Form Template Configuration Configure form templates with validation settings that prevent forms from being created or processed without required date information [2]. This ensures data completeness before document submission. Recommended Settings Enable the rule "Require delivery dates for order confirmations and ship notices" to mandate that suppliers provide delivery dates [1]. This prevents incomplete delivery documents from progressing to the billing stage. Set up tolerance checks and validation rules that verify delivery date completion before allowing subsequent transaction processing. [1] https://help.sap.com/docs/business-network-for-supply-chain/business-network-buyer-administration/order-confirmation-and-ship-notice-rules [2] https://help.sap.com/docs/successfactors-performance-and-goals/implementing-and-managing-360-reviews/360-form-template-settings

entry.title: Re: Departure country from Supplier for Third party sales
entry.content: One option is to create a virtual plant in SAP with the supplier’s country as its location. Assign this plant to third-party items so SAP picks up the correct departure country. This is a workaround but can be effective if you have a limited number of suppliers; else, the other option is to go with custom validation via BAdI SD_TAX_DETERMINE to override the departure country during billing.

entry.title: LMS notification reporting: Extend reporting possibilities
entry.content:
Hi all, 

We are looking for solutions to create a clean report to get an overview of all mails that were sent about a certain class or item. Currently it is not possible as there is no link on the tables between the mails and the classes or items.

We have tried to do it via a "catch all" filtering based on the subject of the mails, but this is not waterproof. So we have launched an improvement request to create an extra field in the table that stores the link to a class and or item. 

If you think this would support your use case(s), please support our enhancement request!

Reporting: Add field in database PA_ARCHIVE_MAIL with link to ITEM or CLASS

entry.title: Re: Tax recorded in entity where the vendor is not where...
entry.content:
Consider the below options

  • If your tax is related to withholding, you can configure extended withholding tax to post to a different company code. However, this doesn’t apply to VAT or sales tax scenarios.
  • Set up a clearing account in Cocode1 that temporarily holds the tax. Then, use a custom program or allocation cycle to transfer the tax to Cocode2 based on expense distribution.
  • Explore going for custom validation via BAdI like BADI_ACC_DOCUMENT or BADI_FI_TAX_POSTING where the logic can be to detect intercompany scenario and Redirect tax line to the company code of the expense (Cocode2)

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public, Which doc. type is allowed for posting interco billing doc. request?
entry.content:
Dear,

We found that it’s possible to post expenses, salaries via Excel template  (App : Import Supplier Invoices,  But it’s not possible to generate the IC billing request directly from the expense posting. Reassign cost and revenues are necessary, before generating the billing request. This is a manual step.

Currently we are investigating a different way to post the expenses.

There are restrictions for the intercompany billing: it supports following posting types:

Timesheet (including Intercompany contingent worker through cost center)
Cancellation of Timesheet
Activity allocation (including Margin Posting)
Cancellation of Activity Allocation
Reassign/Repost Costs and Revenues
Settlement Posting
Concur Posting
Universal Allocation
Cancellation of Universal Allocation
Service Order Confirmation
Cancellation of Service Order Confirmation
Controlling Assessment
Cancellation of Controlling Assessment

In App: Generate intercompany billing request app, we get the error: "failed to create intercompany billing document request, there are no postings , cannot create billing document request"

Could you please assist how to post a intercompany billing document, and what can be its document type?

Thank you.
Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Seamless Planning with Datasphere & SAC: Seamless Planning in the Cloud?
entry.content:
@Xiao_Qi_Png , Yes, the users need to have an account in both SAC and Datasphere tenants. Since the planning data in SAC needs to be written to the relevant space in Datasphere, it is logical to use the same user id for access control instead of a system/DB users (generally these users have no access restriction). 

Please refer to "Access, roles, security" section of this blog from Max 

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/seamless-planning-integration-between-sap-analytics-cloud-and-sap/ba-p/13877679
